results.title: Angels with dirty faces
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Despite his success in musicals and comedies throughout his career, James Cagney will be remembered best for his tough guys roles in “White heat”, “Public enemy” and “Angels with dirty faces”. Boyhood friends Rocky (Cagney) and Jerry (Pat O’Brien) grew up in opposite directions; one a hoodlum, the other a priest overseeing a group of orphans in the neighbourhood where he and Rocky grew up. These youngsters idolise Rocky and soon they’re breaking the law in an effort to win his respect. Fearing for the boys’ future, Father Connelly takes a stand against Rocky’s underworld ways, leading to one of the classic James Cagney shoot outs. The ending of this picture transcends its gangster-film surface and elevates it to that of meaningful social commentary, wherein Rocky has to face the true meaning of courage. The case also includes a young Humphrey Bogart as Rocky’s two-faced lawyer.

results.title: And then there were none = Ten little indians
results.creator_credit: Rene Clair, Harry M Popkin and Popular Pictures
results.brief_description: Ten strangers, each with a criminal past, are invited to attend a party on desolate island off the English coast at the request of a mysterious host, Mr Owen. As the group settle into their sojourn, it gradually dawns on them that they have been gathered on the island to be murdered, one by one, as penance for their crimes. It seems that guests are being murdered according the nursery rhyme, “Ten little Indians”, but even knowing what murder is coming next can’t prevent it- the surviving Indians must find the mysterious Mr Owen, masquerading as one of the guests, to stop the deadly cat and mouse game. Cast includes Walter Huston, Louise Hayward, Roland Young and Judith Anderson. Based on the novel by Agatha Christie.

results.title: Angels over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Lee Garmes, Ben Hecht and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Angels over Broadway is a stylish looking black and white crime drama which takes place on one rainy night in New York. In a nightclub on Broadway called the Pigeon Club a suicidal embezzler arrives, wet and hopeless. He is mistaken as a rich country hick ripe for hustling. An alcoholic playwright becomes involved and the plot unfolds. This film, written and directed by Ben Hecht who is famous for witty and sharp dialogue, is well acted with an impressive cast. The hustler and would-be gangster, Douglas Fairbanks Jr. is teamed with the good-time girl Rita Hayworth. With a fine script of ironic and poetic dialogue this dark drama is compelling. The noir themes of espionage, gambling, suicide and bad guys turning good are present in this shadowy, cynical and articulate film. With an Academy Award nomination for Best Original Screenplay this is a fine film located in the world of loners, hustlers and has-beens. Cast includes Thomas Mitchell and John Qualen.

results.title: And I cried
results.brief_description: We live in a world besieged and besotted by image. Everyone, it seems, wants their fifteen minutes and plenty of people will do whatever it takes to get a piece of the celebrity cake. “And I cried” is a film about wishing to be a movie star. Being a star is about shining bright, a brilliant flash of light against a velvety black night sky. “And I cried” is an exploration, a celebration, a lamentation, of our obsession with the star and the image. Cast includes: Cassandra Tytler, Engelbert Schmidl, Dominic Redfern, Shane Hennessey.

results.title: An Interview with Douglas McLean
results.creator_credit: Douglas McLean and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.

results.title: Angels of war
results.creator_credit: Gavan Daws, Hank Nelson, Andrew Pike and Australian National University. Research School of Pacific Studies
results.brief_description: Papua New Guinea men recount their experiences when war came to their islands in 1942. During three years a million Americans, 300,000 Japanese and nearly half a million Australians fought their way across the country. Cut into their memories are archival film sequences shot by Japanese, American and Australian cameramen and the songs and poems of black men and white writing about life and death in time of war. Now the men speak passionately of the white man’s promises, made to them in war and never kept in peace.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gavan Daws, Hank Nelson, Andrew Pike and Australian National University. Research School of Pacific Studies

results.title: An Interview with Douglas Margetts
results.creator_credit: Douglas Margetts and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.

results.title: Angels in America
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Celia Costas and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: Caustic, funny, politically charged award winning television series, with an all-star cast set in New York City of the mid-1980s, when the horrific effects of AIDS was beginning to be realised. The narrative centres around numerous gay men some infected, some not and how it effects their lives and those of their families. Contains several celestial scenes, as well imaginary humorous settings that allow characters to ruminate and reflect upon their fate. Angels make appearances, the dead are raised and visions of the afterlife abound in this inventive, poetic and insightful work. Cast includes: Meryl Streep, Al Pacino, Mary Louise Parker, Jeffrey Wright and Emma Thompson. Directed by Mike Nichols and written by Tony Kushner, based on his Pulitzer winning play.

results.title: An Interview with Wing Commander Peter Isaacson : Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees (1983-2000)
results.creator_credit: Peter Isaacson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After returning from World War II, having served in the RAAF as a Pathfinder, Peter Isaacson was appointed a Shrine of Remembrance Trustee. He discusses his time at the Shrine, as Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees and the role of the Shrine in helping Australians remember as well as teaching those who don’t remember the history of Australia at war.
results.title_for_label: An Interview with Wing Commander Peter Isaacson : Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees (1983-2000)
